attributes.text:
Mouse event object.

the interface of this class is based on the DOM Level 2 mouse event interface: http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-Events/events.html#Events-eventgroupings-mouseevents

During mouse events caused by the depression or release of a mouse button, this method can be used to check which mouse button changed state.

Only internet explorer can compute the button during mouse move events. For all other browsers the button only contains sensible data during “click” events like “click”, “dblclick”, “mousedown”, “mouseup” or “contextmenu”.

But still, browsers act different on click:

<- = left mouse button
-> = right mouse button
^  = middle mouse button

Browser | click, dblclick | contextmenu
---------------------------------------
Firefox | <- ^ ->         | ->
Chrome  | <- ^            | ->
Safari  | <- ^            | ->
IE      | <- (^ is <-)    | ->
Opera   | <-              | -> (twice)
Get the horizontal position at which the event occurred relative to the left of the document. This property takes into account any scrolling of the page.
The horizontal mouse position in the document.
Get the vertical position at which the event occurred relative to the top of the document. This property takes into account any scrolling of the page.
The vertical mouse position in the document.

Get a secondary event target related to an UI event. This attribute is used with the mouseover event to indicate the event target which the pointing device exited and with the mouseout event to indicate the event target which the pointing device entered.
The secondary event target.

Get the horizontal coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the origin of the screen coordinate system.

Note: This value is usually not very useful unless you want to position a native popup window at this coordinate.
The horizontal mouse position on the screen.

Get the vertical coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the origin of the screen coordinate system.

Note: This value is usually not very useful unless you want to position a native popup window at this coordinate.
The vertical mouse position on the screen.
Get the he horizontal coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the viewport.
The horizontal mouse position
Get the vertical coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the viewport.
The vertical mouse position
Whether the left button is pressed
true when the left button is pressed
Whether the middle button is pressed
true when the middle button is pressed
Whether the right button is pressed
true when the right button is pressed
